snippet: Senator John Kerry and Susan E. Rice, the United Nations ambassador, are considered front-runners to succeed Hillary Rodham Clinton as secretary of state.
abstract: Sen John Kerry and United Nations ambassador Susan E. Rice, considered front-runners to succeed Hillary Clinton as secretary of state, are both dogged by issues that could complicate their path; Rice faces stiff resistance on Capitol Hill, where she has come under criticism from Republicans for asserting attack on Benghazi, Libya, diplomatic mission might have been spontaneous protest; Kerry's appointment would mean his Senate seat could fall into Republican hands.
lead_paragraph: Senator John Kerry and Susan E. Rice, the United Nations ambassador, are considered front-runners to succeed Hillary Rodham Clinton as secretary of state.

headline.seo: Top Candidates to Replace Clinton at State Dept. May Face Hurdles
headline.main: Top Candidates for State Dept. Are Both Facing Possible Hurdles
headline.print_headline: Top Candidates For State Dept. Are Both Facing Possible Hurdles
